game

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class describes a player object which are essential to the correct implementation of the game of Monopoly. It handles all of the interaction with player movement, going to and leaving jail, purchasing of Properties and other squares and most importantly, bankruptcy and how to save the player object from bankruptcy depending on a number of conditions
    Author:
    Robert Keenan and Ciaran Nolan

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String token)
        Class constructor. Initially the player receives £1500 as their money, they are set at location 0 or Go on the square
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player
        token - The token they will be represented on the board with. This is from an array of colours

      • reduceMoney

        public void reduceMoney(int money,
                        Player playerOwed)
        This the method which reduces the amount of money they owe somebody or the Bank. The playerOwed is used to determine if the debt is due to another player such as rent and is set to null if the player owes the bank in terms of taxes etc. If the player cannot pay another player, then they are automatically bankrupt and this calls the bankrupt() method from this class which sells off the current player's assets. If the player cannot pay the bank, then this function calls saveFromBankruptcy() where we attempt to sell assets to obtain money to pay the debt If the player has enough money, then it reduces their balance
        Parameters:
        money - The money to reduce your balance by
        playerOwed - The player object owed, null if owed to the bank

      • movePlayer

        void movePlayer(int moves)
        This handles the movement of a player when they roll a dice or are told to move forward a certain amount of places. It handles the payment of £200 if the player passes or lands on Go
        Parameters:
        moves - The amount of squares to move forward

      • moveToSquare

        public void moveToSquare(int squareNum)
        Moving to a particular square. Handles payment at Go also
        Parameters:
        squareNum - The square number on the board to move to

      • pickCommChestCard

        public void pickCommChestCard()
        Picking a Community Chest card from the top of the deck or the start of the communityChests ArrayList If it is a get out of jail card, it removes it from the deck and places it in the Player's JailCard ArrayList. It runs the dealWithCard method from CommunityChest.java then to execute actions on the given card type

      • pickChanceCard

        public void pickChanceCard()
        Picking a Chance card from the top of the deck or the start of the chances ArrayList If it is a get out of jail card, it removes it from the deck and places it in the Player's JailCard ArrayList. It runs the dealWithCard method from Chance.java then to execute actions on the given card type

      • isInJail

        public boolean isInJail()
        Used to see if the player is in jail
        Returns:
        inJail, jail status

      • setInJail

        void setInJail(boolean jailStatus)
        Set the player in jail
        Parameters:
        jailStatus - Boolean to determine if they should be put in jail

      • bankrupt

        void bankrupt(Player playerOwed)
        This is for when a player is declared bankrupt. If it is the 2nd player of the game to go bankrupt, then the game is over and the winner of the game is calculated. If the bank is owed by playerOwed == null, then saveFromBankruptcy can be run to see can the player avoid a bankruptcy situation. If the current player goes bankrupt to another player, (playerOwed!=null), then everything of the current player's value is given to playerOwed
        Parameters:
        playerOwed - The Player object who is owed money

      • addPurchasedTitleDeed

        public void addPurchasedTitleDeed(TitleDeed purchasedProperty)
        Adding a purchased title deed card to the title deed card list of the Player object and setting the owner of the Title Deed card to be the player object
        Parameters:
        purchasedProperty - The TitleDeed card object of the purchased property

      • removeOwnedTitleDeed

        public void removeOwnedTitleDeed(TitleDeed titleDeed)

        Parameters:
        titleDeed - The TitleDeed card object to remove

      • payRent

        public void payRent(CanOwn ownableSquare)
        This is the payRent function which prompts the owner of the CanOwn object to ask the current player on the square to pay rent. They can either ask for rent or not. The player on the square must then act accordingly . This method calculates how much rent a player will pay depending on how many houses or hotels or properties of the same colour are owned If the current player cannot pay, then they go bankrupt
        Parameters:
        ownableSquare - The CanOwn object to pay rent on

      • bankruptcyMortgage

        void bankruptcyMortgage(int moneyNeedToRaise)
        Used to mortgage a CanOwn object when the player goes bankrupt to the bank
        Parameters:
        moneyNeedToRaise - The amount of money needed to raise to pay the debt

      • bankruptcySellHousesHotels

        private void bankruptcySellHousesHotels(int moneyNeedToRaise)
        Selling houses and hotels when bankrupt to bank
        Parameters:
        moneyNeedToRaise - The amount of money needed to raise to pay the debt

      • completeBankruptcyTrade

        private void completeBankruptcyTrade(java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        Complete the trade of a CanOwn object's TitleDeed card when in bankruptcy in order to raise money
        Parameters:
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit

      • saveFromBankruptcy

        private boolean saveFromBankruptcy(int moneyNeedToRaise)
        This method tries to save a player from bankruptcy when they cannot pay a debt to the bank. It values the houses and hotels on the CanOwn objects and tells you the value they have. It will then make preliminary trades with other Players in the player list. It will enter into a player to player trade. The other player will bid a price and then that value will be stored temporarily but the CanOwn object's TitleDeed card will not change ownership until it is confirmed that the bankrupt player can be saved from bankruptcy. It will continue to ask you to make more trades if you need to make up more money. If you were saved from bankruptcy, then it completes the trades, completes the mortgaging of CanOwn objects and selling of houses and hotels. If not, it clears the bankruptcy status and everything is handled by the bank in terms of selling houses/hotels and then auctioning of CanOwn TitleDeed cards
        Parameters:
        moneyNeedToRaise - Integer value of money needed to raise to save player from bankruptcy
        Returns:
        true if saved, false if not

      • clearBankruptcyTradeStatus

        void clearBankruptcyTradeStatus()
        Clears all of the preliminary trades made for the bankruptcy trades

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints out the values of the Player
